intro: Hieracium subplanifolium, commonly known as the flat-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are broad and flat, often with a hairy texture, and its flowers are yellow with ray florets. It is an herbaceous perennial that can spread through rhizomes, forming dense colonies in suitable habitats.
